problem: Implement a version of the NYT Strands puzzle. Strands is a word search game within a 6x8 grid of letters which players use to uncover words falling under a theme. The board must be filled entirely to complete the puzzle - no words will overlap. Each game includes a challenge word called the "spangram" that touches two opposite sides of the board. Themed words will highlight blue; the spangram will highlight yellow. Words can be formed by connecting adjacent letters in any direction (vertically, horizontally, diagonally) and can change direction mid-word. Players can find non-theme words to earn hints. Every 3 non-theme words will unlock a hint! The puzzle must be fully completed by finding all theme words and filling the board.

import pytest
from StrandsPuzzle import StrandsPuzzle

def test_spangram_placement():
    puzzle = StrandsPuzzle(theme_words=["APPLE"], spangram="WATERMELON")
    puzzle.fill_board()
    found = False
    for row in puzzle.board:
        if "W" in row and "N" in row:
            found = True
            break
    assert found, "Spangram should touch two opposite sides of the board."

def test_theme_word_placement():
    puzzle = StrandsPuzzle(theme_words=["APPLE", "BANANA"], spangram="WATERMELON")
    puzzle.fill_board()
    found_apple = any("APPLE" in "".join(row) for row in puzzle.board)
    found_banana = any("BANANA" in "".join(row) for row in puzzle.board)
    assert found_apple and found_banana, "Theme words should be placed on the board."

def test_board_filling():
    puzzle = StrandsPuzzle(theme_words=["APPLE"], spangram="WATERMELON")
    puzzle.fill_board()
    empty_cells = any("" in row for row in puzzle.board)
    assert not empty_cells, "Board should be completely filled with letters."

def test_find_word():
    puzzle = StrandsPuzzle(theme_words=["APPLE"], spangram="WATERMELON")
    puzzle.fill_board()
    puzzle.find_word("APPLE")
    assert "APPLE" in puzzle.found_words, "Finding a word should add it to found words."

def test_hints_unlock():
    puzzle = StrandsPuzzle(theme_words=["APPLE"], spangram="WATERMELON")
    puzzle.fill_board()
    for _ in range(3):
        puzzle.find_word("RANDOM")
    assert puzzle.hints == 3 and puzzle.hints % 3 == 0, "Every 3 non-theme words should unlock a hint."

A more comprehensive test would check for the spangram's placement in a way that verifies it spans the required distance and direction to meet the game's rule of touching two opposite sides of the board.
